lines.content: Bob is a sarcastic and slightly annoying yet helpful chatbot that helps you keep track of all the things you need to do.
If you are a quick typer, Bob allows you to manage your tasks much faster than regular to-do-list applications.
Add and delete todo tasks, and mark them as completed.
Add and delete deadlines, and mark them as completed.
Add and delete events, and mark them as completed.
View tasks containing a specific keyword.
Be directed to this User Guide.
Automatically save task list in text file, and reload data the next time Bob is launched.
Get a link to this page.
A message that leads users to this page when they click on it.
HA HA do you not know how to talk to me?
Click on this message to view my guide then!
Add a new task to keep track of that has no specific date or deadline.
A new uncompleted todo task "eat bread" will be added to the list of tasks.
Okay okay I've added the task:
Add a new task to keep track of that has a specific deadline.
A new uncompleted deadline task "review bread" with the date "9 Feb 2021" will be added the list of tasks.
Okay okay I've added the task:
Add a new task to keep track of that has a specific date.
A new uncompleted event task "make bread" with the date "12 Feb 2021" will be added the list of tasks.
Okay okay I've added the task:
Displays all the tasks in the list.
All the tasks in the list will be shown.
Here's your tasks! Wow I'm so helpful!
Search for all the tasks in the list that contain a specific keyword.
Returns all the tasks in the list that contain the word "bread".
Are any of these tasks the one you're looking for?
Mark a task in the list as completed.
Marks the task with index number 2 in the list as a completed task.
Wow you finally did something productive!
Delete a task from the list.
Removes the task with index number 1 from the list, and shifts the remaining tasks accordingly.
Images from Among Us and Kimi no Nawa

Bob is a sarcastic and slightly annoying yet helpful chatbot that helps you keep track of all the things you need to do.
If you are a quick typer, Bob allows you to manage your tasks much faster than regular to-do-list applications.
Add and delete todo tasks, and mark them as completed.
Add and delete deadlines, and mark them as completed.
Add and delete events, and mark them as completed.
View tasks containing a specific keyword.
Be directed to this User Guide.
Automatically save task list in text file, and reload data the next time Bob is launched.
Get a link to this page.
A message that leads users to this page when they click on it.
HA HA do you not know how to talk to me?
Click on this message to view my guide then!
Add a new task to keep track of that has no specific date or deadline.
A new uncompleted todo task "eat bread" will be added to the list of tasks.
Okay okay I've added the task:
Add a new task to keep track of that has a specific deadline.
A new uncompleted deadline task "review bread" with the date "9 Feb 2021" will be added the list of tasks.
Okay okay I've added the task:
Add a new task to keep track of that has a specific date.
A new uncompleted event task "make bread" with the date "12 Feb 2021" will be added the list of tasks.

Wow you finally did something productive!
Delete a task from the list.
Removes the task with index number 1 from the list, and shifts the remaining tasks accordingly.

* Represents an exception thrown by Bob while it runs.
public abstract class BobException extends Exception {
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when it is unable to locate the data directory in the user's computer.
* Constructor for a new DirectoryNotFoundException instance.
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when it is unable to locate the bob.txt file in the user's computer.
* Constructor for a new FileNotFoundException instance.
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when the user inputs an invalid date as a deadline or event timing.
* Constructor for a new InvalidDateException instance.
* Gets error message for when the user does not input a valid date for their deadline or event timing.
return "What kind of date is that >:(\n";
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when it receives an unsupported command from the user.
* Constructor for a new InvalidInputException instance.
* Gets error message for when the user input is not one of the supported commands.
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when the user does not specify the deadline of the Deadline task.
* Constructor for a new NoDeadlineException instance.
* Gets error message for when the user does not specify the deadline of their Deadline task.
return "When is the deadline? >:(\nPlease specify the date with the format\n/by YYYY-MM-DD";
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when the user does not specify the timing of the Event task.
* Constructor for a new NoEventTimingException instance.
* Gets error message for when the user does not specify the timing of their Event task.
return "When is the event? >:(\nPlease specify the date with the format\n/at YYYY-MM-DD";
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when the user does not specify the keyword for their task search.
* Constructor for a new NoKeywordException instance.
* Gets error message for when the user does not specify any keyword for their search.
return "What are you even looking for >:(\n";
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when there is no task in the task list that corresponds to their search.
* Constructor for a new NoSearchResultException instance.
* Represents the exception thrown by Bob when the user does not specify the task description
* Constructor for a new NoTaskAndDateException instance.
* Gets error message for when the user does not specify the task description and date of event or deadline.
return "You didn't specify your task OR its date! >:(\n";

* Gets error message for when the user does not specify the task description.
